stanza.line: O call not me to justify the wrongwrong
That thy unkindness lays upon my heartheart
Wound me not with thine eye but with thy tonguetongue
Use power with power and slay me not by artart
Tell me thou lov elsewhere but in my sightsight
Dear heart forbear to glance thine eye asideaside
What need thou wound with cunning when thy mightmight
Is more than my oerpressed defence can bidebide
Let me excuse thee ah my love well knowsknows
Her pretty looks have been mine enemiesenemies
And therefore from my face she turns my foesfoes
That they elsewhere might dart their injuriesinjuries
Yet do not so but since I am near slainslain
Kill me outright with looks and rid my painpain
